55780.name: Staircase in The Alliance Arms
description: This is a small alcove in the Alliance Arms Inn away from the main
bar area to the west.  It houses a small spiral staircase that leads
up to the private rooms that are up for rent for any traveller passing
through the village.

55787.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BB{barracks{B: {WB{wunks{x
description: This is where most of the soldiers sleep.  There is a long row of
beds along the back wall, and a foot locker for each soldier at the
end of their bed.  There is not much privacy as all the beds are next
to each other with no curtains or partitions of any kind.  To the
south is the mess hall and more bunks for additional soldiers are west
of here.

55752.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: The High Road runs through the centre of Port Llast.  To the
southwest a small path heads off to the cliffside edge.  The Harbour
of Port Llast can be seen along the road to the northwest.  Somewhere
to the south, the sounds of machinery or something like that can be
heard.

55756.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {YB{yeach{x
description: Accross the {YS{yands{x of the {YB{yeach{x, an {cI{Cc{Wy co{Cl{cd{x wind blows from the
west, the Sea of Swords.  Just over a small stretch of the sea past
the cliffs it is possible to see the ships docking in the harbour of
{BP{bort {BL{blast{x.  The {YB{yeach{x runs down to the south.  It doesnt look
possible to climb back up the cliffs here to the village.

55797.name: A ledge on the Cliffside
description: Secluded along the cliffside above the beach of Port Llast, is a
small ledge.  There is little room to move, and no way back up the
cliff.  There is a small passageway below the ledge that might just
facilitate someone climbing down to safety.

55759.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: The Coastal Pathway, as the name suggests, runs right along the
edge of the clifftop, along the sword coast.  As with most of the
construction in this village, it is made from fine quality stone.  The
road slopes down to the north, towards the village centre and the
Harbour.

55794.name: {BU{Bm{Db{rer{Dl{Be{be{B'{bs B{Bl{De{rss{Di{Bn{bg A{Bf{Dt{x
description: {yThis section of the boat is used to carry people accross the seas.
Slaves, workers, merchants, anyone who wants cheap passage with no
questions asked.  There is a small shrine dedicated to {bU{Bm{Db{rer{Dl{Be{be{y, the
goddess of oceans, waves, and the sea.  Here sailors or passengers can
offer a prayer of safe voyage for their journey.  A rope ladder leads
up out of the boat.  {x

55778.name: The Cracked Anvil
description: It is quite dark in this shop.  There is much heat coming in from
the forge out the back of the shop.  Suits of armor fill racks in the
shop front, along with the occasional weapon.  A small fire lights the
room, with the smoke escaping through a large stone fireplace set near
the counter.  This is a good place to pick up some basic armor for
surviving the perils of the frozen north.

55788.name: The Alliance Arms Second Floor
description: At the top of the spiral staircase, is a small corridor that runs
off to the west.  To the south is one of the rooms in the inn.  It is
the standard room for general travellers.  The Stone staircase spirals
back down to the main part of Alliance Arms Inn.
{R  _ {WN{wobleman{W'{ws {WR{woom   {CS{ctandard {CR{coom
{R V                          {RV
{x

55751.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: This is the main road running through Port Llast.  It runs along
the edge of the Sword Coast.  To the south the gates of the village
are protected by several guards.  The road curves along to the west,
where it runs closer to the cliff's edge.

55785.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BB{barracks{B: {WM{wess {WH{wall{x
description: This is a large room with a long table that could seat over 100 men
running down the centre.  There are benches attatched to the floor so
that noone can throw them at someone else should a fight break out at
the table.  A serving hatch on the eastern wall allows soldiers to
collect their daily meals when they get hungry.

55754.name: Path to a Beach
description: The pathway twists and turns as it reaches the edge of the
cliffside.  Looking over the edge, it is possible to see a quiet
beach, with golden sands, and the waves crashing into the edge.  There
is quite a chilly breeze on the edge of the cliffside.

55776.name: Wagon Way
description: {wWagon Way terminates in a large cul-de-sac.  It is a large circle
used to allow very large wagons to turn round without getting stuck in
the road, and also leaves room for people to leave their carts while
they stay in the {Cinn {wwhich lies off road to the {Csouth{w.  A large
signpost with a {Ccracked anvil {won it points to the {Cnorth{w, showing the
blacksmith's workshop where armor can be purchased.  Over to the east
are several residential buildings and pathways that seem of little
interest to a typical adventurer.  Far off to the east, the edges of
the Neverwinter Woods can be seen.

55762.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: The High Road continues to run from south to north, towards the
gates of the village.  There is a wide road branching off to the east,
as usual in this village, made from well crafted cobblestones.  The
road is now quite high and as it rises up along the cliff side to the
west, ships arriving and departing from the harbour can be seen.

55761.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: The Coastal Pathway continues north towards the village gates.  To
the northeast, sounds of machinery and the clanging of metal can be
heard.  To the south is the village centre.  The pathway begins to
slope up to the north again, leading back up to the higher part of the
High Road.

55790.name: Nobleman's Room
description: This is a magnificent room.  Paintings line the walls, a woven wool
carpet lines the floor, and there is a splendid view of Haeromos
Dothwintyl Mansion from the south window and the Harbor from the west
window.  In the centre of the room is a giant four poster bed, with
fine silk sheets.  There are some runes on the bed, indicating magical
enchantments that mean you can be healed while you sleep.  There is
also a large chest where you can store your valuables in the corner of
the room.

55755.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {YB{yeach{x
description: At the bottom of a treacherous path down the cliffside is the {YB{yeach{x
of {BP{bort {BL{blast{x.  It is a small beach, with fine sands, weathered by the
waves of the Sea of Swords.  The stretch of the {Yb{yeach{x runs north to
south along the coastline.

55795.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BN{borth {BG{batehouse {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: Built into a massive stone wall, is a small gatehouse with heavy
security.  There are seige engines atop the stone wall, and many arrow
slits so that archers can attack potential enemies from all along the
walls.  There are also the protective wardstones, to prohibit entrance
to the village of animals and monsters.  The gatehouse leads north out
onto the northern heights of the High Road.  Back south is the centre
of the village, and the harbour.
{WTh{we {DSt{con{Ces{W a{wre{D p{cer{Cfe{Wct{wly{D r{wou{Wnd{w a{Dnd{c b{Cea{Wut{wif{Dul{wly
{Wsm{woo{Dth{c. {CTh{Wey{w g{Dlo{cw {Cwi{Wth{w a{D p{wow{Wer{wfu{Dl {cma{Cgi{Wc {wpr{Dob{wab{Wly
{Wcr{wea{Dte{cd {Cby{W s{wom{De {cve{Cry{W p{wow{Der{wfu{Wl {wan{Dd {cel{Cde{Wr {wel{Dve{wn
{Wwi{wza{Drd{c. {CNo{W n{won{D-i{cnt{Cel{Wli{wge{Dnt{w c{Wre{wat{Dur{ce {Cma{Wy {wpa{Dss
{Wth{wro{Dug{ch {Can{Wy {war{Dea{c p{Cro{Wte{wct{Ded{w b{Wy {wth{Des{ce {Cwa{Wrd{wst{Don{wes{W.

55771.name: Cobblestone Road
description: {wThis road is built by the fine stonecutters of Port Llast.  The
stones are perfectly smooth and the road is lined with tall oak trees.
It runs east to the town's richly decorated mansion, home of Haeromos
Dothwintyl.  {x

55791.name: Standard Room
description: This room is fairly nicely decorated with a couple of paintings on
the wall and animal firs on the floor.  There is a small bed in the
corner next to a window that overlooks Wagon Way.  There is a small
desk in the corner and a cupboard to leave equipment in.  The door is
made of oak, and leads north back to the stairwell.

55758.name: The Stone Quarry
description: Port Llast is famous for it's stone cutters.  This is the main
entrance to the quarry where the stone is mined.  Wardstones are
magically placed into the ground in case anymining leads to some
underground monsters that could invade the village.  The quarry is
naturally bordered by the cliffs along the sword coast, and to the
west and the south, the sea of swords.

55774.name: The Jack and Saber
description: The Jack and Saber is a below average tavern.  The air is filled
with a hazy smoke that dims the light and creates a darker ambiance.
The ceiling is low, and taller patrons have to watch their heads on
the low oak beams that hold up the ceiling.  There are a few tables
with a few sorry folk drowning their woes, or quietly socialising with
a friend or two.  At the back of the tavern, a stocky looking man is
selling potent brews.

55764.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor{x
description: To the west of the High Road is the harbour road.  It is a small
pathway that runs north to south along the coastline.  There is a
constant hussle of dockers, sailors and other workmen all around the
harbour loading and unloading all the ships as they arrive.  A couple
of fairly large ships are moored along the north side of the harbour,
and to the south, the harbour master's office sits at the end of the
road.

55784.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BB{barracks{B: {WE{wntrance {WH{wall{x
description: This is the main entrance hall of the barracks.  There is a large
stone circle in the centre where warriors can spar with eachother as
and when they choose.  There is the sound all around of soldiers
equipping themselves, checking weapons, chatting away with eachother
and the occasional arguement.  To the north are several bunks, and
there is a mess hall to the east.  The door to the south leads back
into the village.

55753.name: Path to a Beach
description: A small path twists off of the main high road running through Port
Llast.  It slopes down to the south, towards the Sword Coast, and down
to sea level.  It is possible to see the waves crashing onto the beach
down the bottom of the path below.

55793.name: {BU{Bm{Db{rer{Dl{Be{be{B'{bs B{Bl{De{rss{Di{Bn{bg{x
description: {yThis boat is a large vessel, capable of carrying over 100 large
crates.  There are several crates situated throughout this boat, they
have carried food supplies from the west to Port Llast, and will be
filled with goods from the quarry when it leaves.  The boat extends
further southward, into a small room at the aft of the boat.  {x

55768.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor{x
description: The Road reaches its end here.  To the west, a smaller jetty allows
smaller class sailing vessels to load and unload their cargo.  The
rest of the harbour can be seen to the southwest, where great ships
can sail in all their splendour.

55775.name: Wagon Way
description: {wWagon Way, a smoothly stone cobbled, and rather wide road, runs
from west to east.  To the {Cnorth{w, a path leads to a large building
with the symbol of the flaming fist atop the door.  A sign points
{Csouth {wto {CWhaelgund's Wheelrace{w, the village's workshop for repairing
carts, wagons, and pretty much any road vehicle.  The only {Cinn {win Port
Llast is off to the {Ceast{w.  {x

55777.name: Whaelgund's Wheelrace
description: This is a rather large shop, and typical of the buildings in the
village, is built with large stone blocks.  The ceiling is very high,
and the doorway to the north is extra wide and large, to allow
Whealgund's Wagons to easily be brought into the shop and taken out
when sold.  There is a smaller workshop out the back where repairs are
frequently performed.  There is often the clatter of workmen fixing
the carts that fall prey to ware and tear, or attacks by the orcs and
goblins from Neverwinter Woods.

55779.name: The Alliance Arms
description: This is the only Inn in Port Llast, and so, it is not the best
quality.  The main bar here is the style of an old farmhouse.  There
are large oak beams supporting the ceiling, and a very rustic feel to
the decor.  The tables are all made from the oak trees common in the
village.  To the east a large staircase leads to the rooms where weary
travellers can rest the night before continuing their travells to the
north.

55786.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BB{barracks{B: {WB{wunks{x
description: This is where most of the soldiers sleep.  There is a long row of
beds along the back wall, and a foot locker for each soldier at the
end of their bed.  There is not much privacy as all the beds are next
to each other with no curtains or partitions of any kind.  To the
south is the main entrance hall, and more bunks for additional
soldiers are east of here.

55767.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor{x
description: The harbour road runs northward towards the edge of the inlet in
the cliffs that has allowed this harbour to be built.  To the west,
ships can be seen sailing in and out of the harbour quite often.
There is a large ship moored to the west of here along the pier.

55757.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {YB{yeach{x
description: The {YB{yeach{x curves east, hugging the coastling tightly.  {BW{ca{Cv{ce{Bs{x crash
all along the sandy {YB{yeach{x bringing a {cc{Co{Wld wi{Cn{cd{x.  To the east is the
main entrance to the stone quarry, where stones are worked into
whatever is needed, be it bricks for a wall, or slabs for a road.

55769.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor{x
description: Just off the south side of this pier, a large boat is moored.  It
is called Umberlee's Blessing, and is a large cargo ship taking crates
of supplies accross the Sea of Swords.  The pier itself is built atop
huge stone pillars that sink for what could be miles under the sea
surface, an example of the fine craftsmanship of the stonecutters in
Port Llast.

55789.name: The Alliance Arms Second Floor
description: The corridor comes to an end here.  To the south there is an oak
door with a strong lock on it.  The corridor runs back to the east and
the spiral staircase which leads down to the main room in the inn.
{W N{wobleman{W'{ws {WR{woom   {CS{ctandard {CR{coom {R_   {YS{ytairs
{R      V                           V
{x

55750.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BS{bouth {BG{bates {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: This is the south gates to the small village of {BP{bort {BL{blast{x.  To the
west and the east, a large stone wall surrounds the village,
protecting it from dangerous monsters, and potential attacks.  {yT{rh{ye{x
{yHi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{x leads south away from the city.  Also highly visible around
the gates are several {WW{wa{Dr{cd{Cst{Wo{wn{De{ws{x.  These wardstones are encased in the
ground by magical means.  They can be found in most of the towns and
cities of the north, as the environment outside is very dangerous.
These wards typically prevent certain creatures, such as wolves and
orcs, from passing through them.

55763.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: The Coastal Pathway continues to follow the edge of the cliffside,
south to the village centre, and northwest to leave the town and head
off to the colder less inviting settlements of the north.

55796.name: Path to a Beach
description: The pathway twists and turns as it reaches the edge of the
cliffside.  Looking over the edge, it is possible to see a quiet
beach, with golden sands, and the waves crashing into the edge.  There
is quite a chilly breeze on the edge of the cliffside.

55792.name: Merchant's Boat
description: {yYou find yourself inside a small boat.  There are a few crates with
nothing important left in them.  A fine wooden hull is visible behind
several maps of distant lands.  There is a ladder near the mast in the
centre of the boat that will allow people to leave the boat{x

55781.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: As the road bends round to the east, it leaves a clear view of the
harbor to the south.  It is also possible to see waves crashing up
against the cliffs.  The village gates are not far ahead to the north,

55765.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor{x
description: The harbour road reaches its end here.  To the west is the harbour
master's office.  The rest of the harbour lies to the north.  As the
harbour is set in a small valley in the cliffs of the sword coast,
nothing but unscaleable rocks can be seen to the south and east.

55770.name: {BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor{x
description: This is a smaller jetty where a boat can moor itself.  It is made
of tough oak wood, and the pillars supporting it go deep into the sea
bed.  It is very cold and the wind from the sword coast makes even the
toughest of men feel a chattering cold down to their bones.

55772.name: Cobblestone Road
description: The fine cobblestone road continues towards the mansion of Haeromos
Dothwintyl.  It can be seen just over to the east.  To the south,
behind the tall oak trees is a small tavern, the Jack and Saber.

55773.name: The gates to A Mansion
description: To the east lies a large mansion.  It is the home of First Captain
Haeromos Dothwintyl, the man who is in charge of the village.  The
gates are closed and locked, and more of the familiar magical wards
can be seen protecting the gates so that noone may enter.  Back to the
west, Cobblestone Road leads back to the centre of the village.
{WTh{we {DSt{con{Ces{W a{wre{D p{cer{Cfe{Wct{wly{D r{wou{Wnd{w a{Dnd{c b{Cea{Wut{wif{Dul{wly
{Wsm{woo{Dth{c. {CTh{Wey{w g{Dlo{cw {Cwi{Wth{w a{D p{wow{Wer{wfu{Dl {cma{Cgi{Wc {wpr{Dob{wab{Wly
{Wcr{wea{Dte{cd {Cby{W s{wom{De {cve{Cry{W p{wow{Der{wfu{Wl {wan{Dd {cel{Cde{Wr {wel{Dve{wn
{Wwi{wza{Drd{c. {CNo{W n{won{D-i{cnt{Cel{Wli{wge{Dnt{w c{Wre{wat{Dur{ce {Cma{Wy {wpa{Dss
{Wth{wro{Dug{ch {Can{Wy {war{Dea{c p{Cro{Wte{wct{Ded{w b{Wy {wth{Des{ce {Cwa{Wrd{wst{Don{wes{W.

55783.name: Pathway to The Barracks
description: A stone roadway runs north here to a large building, housing
several troops from the cities of Baldur's Gate and Neverwinter.  They
are stationed here to discourage attack from the pirate controlled
town of Luskan, and to protect the town from any other attacks.

55766.name: Harbour Master's Office
description: This office must be one of the few buildings in Port Llast that
isnt made from stone.  It is build from oak wood, like an old log
cabin in the woods.  Shelves with sea charts and other nautical
information line the back walls, and a large desk takes up the centre
of the office.  Through a window to the north, the harbour in it's
splendour is visible.
{BP{bort {BL{blast {BH{barbor
{x  To the west of the High Road is the harbour road.  It is a small
pathway that runs north to south along the coastline.  There is a
constant hussle of dockers, sailors and other workmen all around the
harbour loading and unloading all the ships as they arrive.  A couple
of fairly large ships are moored along the north side of the harbour,
and to the south, the harbour master's office sits at the end of the
road.

55782.name: The Coastal Pathway {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: The road runs from south to north, with many large boulders along
the side of the road.  They are remains of the old village wall, that
was used to protect the village from raiders.  It did not withstand an
old assault and has had to be rebuilt with finances from Neverwinter
and Baldur's Gate.  There are sounds of several guards at the gates to
the north.

55760.name: The Village Centre {r-{y+{r-{yT{rh{ye Hi{rg{yh R{ro{yad{r-{y+{r-{x
description: This is the centre of the village of Port Llast.  There is very
little activity for a village centre.  People tend to keep to
themselves in this village.  The constant threat of attack from
Luskan, or dangerous monsters make this village like a ghost town.
People go about their business only when necessary.  To the west is
the harbour, where most of the villagers who dont work in the quarries
work.  To the east, a small path leads to the mansion of Haeromos
Dothwintyl, the man in charge of keeping the village safe.  The
Coastal Pathway continues to the north.

55750.name: Jack the Bartender~
description:
A man stands before you 5'3" tall.  He is very stockily built, a
strong man with large muscles petruding through his tatterd shirt.  He
has a short black beard to match his short black hair, and is wearing
a leather apron that has soaked enough spilled alcohol in its time to
constantly smell, and would be very dangerous to wear near to naked
flames.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
55750.room_name: A short stocky bartender stands behind the bar ready to serve his customers.

55751.name: Whaelgund~
description:
Whaelgund is a stout jolly fellow, human, but with typical
mannerisms of a dwarf.  He is constantly telling jokes, singing, and
making a nuisance of himself.  He is wearing firs and leathers, as
although his work is hard, the open doors of the shop make it very
cold.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
55751.room_name: Whaelgund is here selling and repairing wagons and carts.

55752.name: Haljal Throndor~
description:
A dwarf about 4ft tall stands before you.  He is wearing some of
his work, a suit of chainmail armor mainly to show his quality work.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M GRALL 55753 75~
M SPEECH 55754 reformed~
M SPEECH 55752 staff of revelation~
55752.room_name: Haljal Throndor The Blacksmith is here selling his goods.

55753.name: a serving wench~
description:
A beautiful 5'4" woman stands behind the bar wearing a low cut
white silk blouse.  Sheis probably wearing other things, but her low
cut blouse is enough to distract anyone's attention.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
55753.room_name: A Beautiful serving wench stands behind the bar waiting your orders.

55754.name: the Innkeeper~
description:
A tall fellow, this innkeeper is around 6'1" tall.  He is a
halfelf, but that is only noticeable by his pointed ears, otherwise to
all purposes, he looks human.  He is dressed in fine clothes and sits
in his chair talking to the patrons of the inn.
55754.room_name: The Innkeeper sits here in his chair selling keys to the rooms.

55755.name: an Alliance Arms Patron~
description:
This person is a typical working class peasant.  Not too wealthy,
but enough to get by on.  They spend their spare time in the bar
drinking.
55755.room_name: A Patron of the Alliance Arms staggers around, smelling of alcohol.

55756.name: A Drunk Dwarf~
description:
A small little dwarf is here.  He is obviously drunk as he
splutters and staggers around the inn.
55756.t_flags: T Out of ma way, I need a BEER!~
55756.room_name: A little dwarf runs around here swaying and staggering.

55757.name: a {BP{bort {BL{blast {WG{wate {WG{wuard{x~
description:
This guard is well dressed in chain and plate armor, and equipped
with maces, axes, and all sorts of weapons.  He is very muscular and
strong looking, and the weight of the armor doesnt seem to hinder him
at all.
55757.room_name: A {BP{bort {BL{blast {WG{wate {WG{wuard{x stands here ready to defend the village.

55758.name: the soldier of the {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x~
description:
Before you stands a knight dressed in the platemail armor of the
Flaming Fist, a group of knights that protect Baldurs Gate, but have
been hired to serve at Port Llast to protect from raiders, mosters and
Luskans.
55758.room_name: {xA tall knight stands here in full platemail of the {RF{rl{Ra{rm{Ri{rn{Rg {rF{Ri{rs{Rt{x

55759.name: a {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr {xSoldier~
description:
Wearing the chainmail armor of a {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr {xSoldier,
this man is tough, fearless and ready to defent {BP{bort {BL{blast{x
from all who attack the town.
55759.t_flags: T Damn those {wL{Wu{Cs{ck{Da{Wn{x's. {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr {mwill defend {BP{bort {BL{blast{m from their treachary.{x~
55759.room_name: A Soldier in the uniform of the city of {WN{we{Dv{Be{Dr{ww{Di{Bn{Dt{we{Wr{x is ready for action here.

55760.name: a {BP{bort {BL{blast{W G{wuard{x~
description:
Before you stands a human wearing chainmail armor andthe symbols of
Port Llast.  He is a well built man, fit enough to break up street
fights or help keep the village safe.

55761.name: a drunk~
description:
This is your typical staggering drunk, standing out in the crowd
causing a nuisance.
55761.room_name: A drunk is here causing a nuisance.

55762.name: a village commoner~
description:
You look at a typical village commoner, normal clothes, nothing
expensive, They tend to shun you as they seem to always be on edge.
55762.t_flags: T Hrm, strangers. Better not be from Luskan!~
55762.room_name: A village commoner is here going quietly about their business.

55763.name: the Harbour Master~
description:
This half elf is in charge of the ships timetables, where they are
going, and when.  He is also in charge of keeping the docks working in
the harbour at maximum capacity.  If people are slacking it is up to
him to get them working again.
55763.room_name: The Harbour Master is here working at his desk.

55764.name: cliffside mprog distributor~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M EXALL 55750 5~
55764.room_name: Mob to distribute cliffside mprogs is here.

55765.name: a Dock Worker~
55765.room_name: A Dock Worker is working here.

55766.name: a {8spy {xfrom {CL{cuskan{x~
description:
He is short, bald and smells like water hasn't touched him in
weeks.  He wears a uniform of an Alliance Arms' steward, but it is
much too small for him, as his bulging belly causes the buttons to
stretch near to breaking.  He stands here, frantically searching
through papers of a noble guest, who has left for the city life.  He
appears nervous as if he was caught doing something he wasn't supposed
to be doing.
55766.room_name: A nervous little man stands here rummaging through drawers and papers.
